alert.note: Alert for McCurtain (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 08 at 11:33AM CST until February 09 at 5:46PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Glover River At Glover affecting McCurtain County. For the Glover River...including Glover...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Glover River At Glover. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Minor to moderate flooding will take place on the Glover River west of Glover, Oklahoma and especially at its confluence with the Little River west of Golden, Oklahoma. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 16.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM CST Wednesday was 16.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.5 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.5 feet on 01/25/2012. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 1145 AM CST.
